## GAD-7 vs CBS: A Comparative Study

The process of comparing and harmonising questionnaires like the Generalised Anxiety Disorder Assessment (GAD-7) and the Child Behaviour Scale (CBS) can be tedious, subjective and time-consuming. However, this process, commonly known as GAD-7 vs CBS, has been simplified by innovative software known as Harmony. Harmony uses advanced natural language processing and generative AI models to analyse and compare questionnaires, even those in different languages. Harmony, a convenient and indispensable tool, rescues researchers from the task of manually sifting through lengthy PDFs of questionnaires, compiling them into Excel spreadsheets, and then attempting to match items.

## Compare the items in GAD-7 English and CBS

* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import GAD-7 and CBS into Harmony and harmonise them</a> - find similarities between the two instruments using our AI platform
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just GAD-7 into Harmony</a> - compare GAD-7 English with other instruments
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just CBS into Harmony</a> - compare CBS with other instruments

For a comparative study like GAD-7 vs CBS, psychologists and social scientists can now rely on Harmony's large language models to compare the instruments and provide a percentage match for each item in GAD-7 and CBS. This easy comparison facilitates the formulation of more accurate and comprehensive analysis and studies. Inclusive of a wide list of instruments in its database, Harmony allows researchers to select the required set for comparison or even upload their own instruments in PDF format. The softwareâ€™s user-friendly interface, available at https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app, is designed to maximize ease of use and efficiency for the user. To truly streamline and expedite comparative studies like GAD-7 vs CBS, Harmony is the tool to adopt for a more synchronized and effective approach.
 
## Questions in GAD-7

|   No. | GAD-7 English                                                                                                                                      |
|------:|:---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
|     1 | Feeling nervous, anxious, or on edge                                                                                                               |
|     2 | Not being able to stop or control worrying                                                                                                         |
|     3 | Worrying too much about different things                                                                                                           |
|     4 | Trouble relaxing                                                                                                                                   |
|     5 | Being so restless that it is hard to sit still                                                                                                     |
|     6 | Becoming easily annoyed or irritable                                                                                                               |
|     7 | Feeling afraid, as if something awful might happen                                                                                                 |
|     8 | If you checked any problems, how difficult have they made it for you to do your work, take care of things at home, or get along with other people? |
